body_content.explanation: to choose something, especially after thinking carefully about several possibilities:
examples: They have to decide by next Friday.
It doesn't matter to me which one we have - you decide.
In the end, we decided to go to the theatre.
She decided (that) she would travel to India.
I can't decide what to do.
He can't decide whether to buy it.
The committee decided in favour of (= made a formal judgment to choose) the cheapest option.

body_content.explanation: to be the reason or situation that makes a particular result happen:
examples: The weather decided the outcome of the tennis match.
Tim's mistake decided the game (= caused him to lose).
